text: Pelham is a city and suburb of Birmingham in Shelby County, Alabama, United States. At the 2020 census the population was 24,318. It was named for famed American Civil War officer John Pelham. ==Related pages== *Death of Tina Watson, a Pelham, Alabama woman whose drowning in 2003 became world news ==References== Category:Cities in Alabama
title: Pelham, Alabama
